type object

type object
props
port
type integer
format int32
desc the network port
protocol
type string
desc the network protocol for the port

values are either tcp or udp defaults to tcp
enableimplicitnetworkpolicy
type boolean
format boolean
desc allow the internet to connect to the port

when true this port will be given an implicit network policy of priority 65534 permitting 0000/0 access to the port this can be overridden by creating network policies of a higher priority to block the port

tcpsocket
type object
props
port
type integer
format int32
desc the tcp port to quert
desc connect to an instances tcp port
schName v1tcpsocketaction
initialdelayseconds
type integer
format int32
desc the number of seconds after a workload instance has started before liveness probes are initiated
timeoutseconds
type integer
format int32
desc the number of seconds after which a probe times out

defaults to 1 second minimum value is 1
periodseconds
type integer
format int32
desc how often in seconds to perform a probe

default to 10 seconds minimum value is 1
successthreshold
type integer
format int32
desc the minimum consecutive successes for a probe to be considered successful after having failed

defaults to 1 must be 1 for liveness minimum value is 1
failurethreshold
type integer
format int32
desc the minimum consecutive failures for a probe to be considered failed after having succeeded

defaults to 3 minimum value is 1
desc a health check probe against a workload instance to determine if it is alive or ready to receive traffic
schName v1probe

schName v1resourcerequirements
desc the specification for a volume claim
schName v1volumeclaimspec
phase
type string
enum
volumeclaimphaseunspecified
pending
unbound
bound
default volumeclaimphaseunspecified
desc which phase a volume claim is currently in

 volumeclaimphaseunspecified stackpath is unable to determine the volume claims state
  pending the volume claim is pending
  unbound the volume claim is unbound
  bound the volume claim is bound to an instance
schName volumeclaimvolumeclaimphase
desc a claim for a volume

volumes may be attached to workload instance containers or virtual machines
schName v1volumeclaim
desc a list of claims that instances may reference

the slug of the claim will be used in combination with the name of the instance to create a stable identifier the slug should be used in the volume mount specifications for containers and vms

status
type string
enum
active
suspended
billingsuspended
inactive
default active
desc which status a workload is currently in

 active the workload is active
  suspended the workload is suspended
  billingsuspended the workload is suspended due to nonpayment
  inactive the workload is inactive or has been deleted
schName v1workloadstatus
desc a computing workload

workloads define a computing application to deploy to stackpaths edge network
schName v1workload
